description: Learned borrowing from Latin catachrēsis, borrowed from Ancient Greek κατάχρησις (katákhrēsis, “misuse (of a word)”).

definitionGroups.group: A misuse of a word; an application of a term to something which it does not properly denote.

entries.meaning: (often, especially) Such a misuse involving some similarity of sound between the misused word and the appropriate word.
(rhetoric) A misapplication or overextension of figurative or analogical description; a wrongly applied metaphor or trope.
